name: v5.0.0
body:
* Updated Redis v8 to v9 by @Lepidopteron in https://github.com/hellofresh/health-go/pull/78
* Add support to optionally opt-in on System metrics by @eliflores in https://github.com/hellofresh/health-go/pull/82
* Change the redis check to accept a DSNs with credentials by @eliflores in https://github.com/hellofresh/health-go/pull/83
* Prevent Check to send result to closed channel by @lucasmdrs in https://github.com/hellofresh/health-go/pull/85

name: v4.7.0
body:
* Component description can be provided alongside system infos by @obouchet-unity in https://github.com/hellofresh/health-go/pull/75
* Run checks concurrently by @vgarvardt in https://github.com/hellofresh/health-go/pull/76

name: v4.6.0
body:
- InfluxDB health check (thx to @nsuprun)
- Min supported Go version is 1.17 as 1.16 reached EOL
- Dependencies updated to the current latest versions

name: v4.5.0
body: Use new official `github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go` package for AMQP

name: v4.4.3
body: - OpenTelemetry 1.0

name: v4.4.2
body: - OpenTelemetry v1.0-RC3 compatible version

name: v4.4.1
body: * OpenTelemetry v1.0-RC2 compatible version

name: Context and dial timeout support for RabbitMQ check
body: - https://github.com/hellofresh/health-go/pull/61, thx to @shmel1k

name: Memcached health check
body:
- Memcached health check support (thx to @mecitsemerci)
- OpenTelemetry v0.16

name: Context-aware checks
body:
- No more package-level vars - health-checks container should be instantiated first
- Configure health-checks container with options
- Tracing support to track how long every individual check takes
- Checks are context-aware
- Added new Postgres check implementation based on pgx/v4

name: Switch to go-redis client as gomodule removed version being used
body: Fixes https://github.com/hellofresh/health-go/issues/43

name: Expose method to run health checks w/out HTTP handler
Return wrapped errors instead of logging
body:
- No more internal logging - return wrapped errors instead.
- Proper go modules versioning.

name: Fixed MySQL and PG connections leak
Officially OSS
body: Just Apache 2.0 license file added

name: Use official mongo driver for healthcheck instead of deprecated and unmaintained one
Backport RabbitMQ channel fixes, and catch up 1.x branch
body:
Some users of this library may be depending upon a `1.x` version, but since the RabbitMQ check was serious enough, we have backported the RabbitMQ check.

There was however, some additionally PRs merged to master before the library moved on to versions `2.x` that were not included in a prior release. As such, this release additionally catches up to the `1.x` branch.

What’s changed:
* `checks/rabbitmq`: in the event of a consume timeout, a send on `done` channel could happen after closing the `done` channel
* `checks/rabbitmq`: if a `messages` channel unexpectedly receives more than 1 message, it will block indefinitely
* `checks/mysql`: added (is API divergent from `2.x`)
* travis files

name: Subtle RabbitMQ channel fixes.
body:
Fixes two subtle race-conditions in the `checks/rabbitmq` package:
* in the event of a consume timeout, a send on `done` channel could happen after closing the `done` channel
* if a `messages` channel unexpectedly receives more than 1 message, it will block indefinitely

name: RabbitMQ aliveness test
body:
Added aliveness test in [_examples/server.go](https://github.com/hellofresh/health-go/blob/master/_examples/server.go).
Please use RabbitMQ aliveness test if your app has access to RabbitMQ management port (15672).

name: Checks update
body:
New health-go 2.0 version released:
 - MySQL check updated
 - PostgreSQL check updated
 - Http check test added 
 - More examples in `__examples/server.go` file

## Release Notes
This release adds validation for checkers being added more than once

## Changelog

https://github.com/hellofresh/health-go/pull/17/commits

name: Fix send on closed channel during rabbit timeout
body: When RabbitMQ health check timed out it was causing a panic in the running application: `send on closed channel`

name: Fixed RabbitMQ checker and added some tests
Several checkers implementations
body:
- RabbitMQ
- Redis
- PostgreSQL
- HTTP
